Hedrick Brothers Construction (HBC) is committed to delivering every project safely, on time, and within budget while exceeding our client's expectations. Our project team operates under the following principles:

1. Safety First — Every team member has the authority and responsibility to stop work if unsafe conditions exist.
2. Quality Built In — We build it right the first time through proactive planning and quality control.
3. Open Communication — Transparent communication with our owner, design team, and trade partners is essential.
4. Collaborative Problem Solving — We approach challenges as a team, leveraging the expertise of all project stakeholders.
5. Continuous Improvement — We learn from every project and apply those lessons to improve our processes.

HBC's Quality Control Program ensures that all work meets or exceeds the requirements of the contract documents. The following quality control measures are implemented on every project:

1. Pre-Installation Conferences — Held with each trade contractor before beginning their scope of work.
2. Material Verification — All materials verified against submittals before installation.
3. First-Work-in-Place Inspections — Initial installation inspected and approved before proceeding.
4. Mock-Up Requirements — Full-scale mock-ups for critical assemblies as required by specifications.
5. Quality Concerns — [See live data from Quality Concerns module]
6. Inspection Documentation — Digital inspection reports filed daily.
7. Non-Conformance Tracking — NCRs tracked in project management system with corrective actions.
8. Third-Party Testing — Testing labs engaged per specification requirements.
9. Commissioning Coordination — Cx agent integrated into construction process.
10. Punch List Management — Systematic walk-throughs at 50%, 75%, and 100% completion.

A preconstruction meeting shall be held within 10 business days of Notice to Proceed. The meeting agenda includes:

1. Introductions and project team organization
2. Communication protocols and points of contact
3. Submittal and RFI procedures
4. Pay application process and schedule of values
5. Change order procedures
6. Safety requirements and site-specific plans
7. Schedule review and milestone dates
8. Site logistics and access plan
9. Quality control requirements
10. Document management procedures

HBC's Safety Program is designed to protect every person on our jobsites. Our safety program includes:

1. Site-Specific Safety Plan developed for each project
2. Weekly toolbox talks conducted by superintendent
3. Daily Job Hazard Analyses (JHAs) for all high-risk activities
4. Safety orientation required for all workers before site access
5. Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) requirements enforced
6. Substance abuse policy — zero tolerance
7. Fall protection plan for all work above 6 feet
8. Confined space entry procedures
9. Hot work permit program
10. Crane and rigging safety program
11. Electrical safety / LOTO procedures
12. Emergency action plan and evacuation routes
13. First aid stations and AED locations posted
14. Safety Concerns — [See live data from Safety Concerns module]
15. Incident investigation and reporting procedures
16. Monthly safety audits by Safety Director

HBC maintains strict cost control through the following procedures:

1. Monthly cost reports prepared and reviewed with Project Executive
2. Cost-to-complete forecasts updated monthly
3. Change order management — all potential changes logged immediately
4. Contingency tracking and drawdown monitoring
5. [See live data from Risk & Cost Management module for buyout, risks, and savings]
6. Subcontractor payment certification process
7. Material cost tracking and procurement coordination
8. Self-perform work cost monitoring
9. Value engineering opportunities evaluated continuously
10. Back-charge documentation and enforcement
11. Insurance claim documentation procedures

Each team member has defined responsibilities as outlined in the Internal Responsibility Matrix. Key roles include:

• Project Executive (PX) — Overall project oversight, client relationship, financial accountability
• Senior Project Manager (Sr. PM) — Day-to-day project management, scheduling, cost control
• Project Manager (PM) — Subcontract administration, submittals, RFIs, pay applications
• Assistant Project Manager (APM) — Support PM with document control, meetings, correspondence
• Project Administrator (PA) — Administrative support, filing, correspondence tracking
• Superintendent — Field operations, safety, quality, schedule execution
• Project Accountant — Billing, cost reporting, budget management
• QA/QC Manager — Quality control inspections, mock-ups, testing coordination

Detailed assignments are maintained in the Responsibility Matrix module.

Effective site management is critical to project success. HBC's site management approach includes:

1. Site logistics plan reviewed and updated monthly
2. Material delivery coordination — 2-week rolling schedule
3. Subcontractor coordination meetings weekly
4. 3-week look-ahead schedule distributed weekly
5. Daily reports completed by superintendent
6. Photo documentation — daily and milestone
7. Visitor management and site access control
8. Environmental compliance monitoring

Project administration procedures ensure consistent and thorough documentation:

1. Buyout Schedule — [See PMP-specific buyout target date]
2. Pay Application Process — Monthly billing per AIA format, submitted by 25th of each month
3. Lien Release Tracking — Conditional and unconditional waivers tracked for every pay period
4. Insurance Certificate Management — All subcontractor certificates verified and tracked

Before each trade contractor begins work, a Pre-Work Meeting is conducted covering:

1. Scope of work review and clarification
2. Schedule requirements and milestones
3. Safety requirements and site-specific hazards
4. Quality expectations and inspection hold points
5. Material storage and handling requirements
6. Coordination with other trades
7. Clean-up responsibilities
8. Communication protocols
9. Change order procedures
10. Payment terms and billing procedures
